item.title: 5. Sustainable Development
item.description: *Taken from The Civil Engineering Exam 5. Sustainable Development While there are now people making whole careers as environmental specialists, your job as a Chartered Civil Engineer will require very intricate involvement with sustainability studies, as described by these sub-parts.

item.title: Classes of Carbon-Dioxide Emissions
item.description: Scopes of Carbon-Dioxide Emissions *Taken from Plana.Earth guide here. Carbon emissions are responsible for 81% of all overall greenhouse gas emissions, and companies including construction are largely responsible for this.

item.title: Galliford Try Net Zero 2030
item.description: Galliford Try Net Zero 2030 Galliford Try is addressing the climate emergency by committing to Net Zero carbon across it’s own operations by 2030, and Net Zero across all activities by 2045.

item.title: SEATS Course Notes
item.description: Site Environmental Awareness Training Scheme (SEATS) Course Notes The [[Construction Industry Training Board (CITB)]] runs a training course around site environmental awareness, based around the GE700 publication, which runs through various considerations on site.

item.title: Sustainability MOC
item.description: Sustainability MOC Sustainability within Civil Engineering is an ever-evolving topic, with new innovations and legislation guiding the industry to embrace sustainability.

item.title: UN member states
item.description: UN member states The list of UN member states is as follows: Afghanistan Albania Algeria Andorra Angola Antigua and Barbuda Argentina Armenia Australia Austria Azerbaijan Bahamas item.title: UNESCO Sustainable Development Goals
item.description: UNESCO Sustainable Development Goals [!NOTE] The UNESCO Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) In September 2015, all of the UN member states convened and developed 17 development goals to be targeted through to 2030.
